info.title: Production Order Confirmation
info.description: You can create time  ticket confirmations and confirmations on  order level, read them, and cancel the  confirmations on time ticket or order  level.

x-sap-shortText: Create, read, and cancel confirmations for production orders using this synchronous inbound service

values.text: Manufacturing Execution - Order and Confirmation Integration (SAP_COM_0522)
[ Make-to-Stock Production - Discrete Manufacturing (BJ5)](https://rapid.sap.com/bp/#/scopeitems/BJ5 " Link To BP ")
[Make-to-Stock - Process Manufacturing Based on Process Order (BJ8)](https://rapid.sap.com/bp/#/scopeitems/BJ8 " Link To BP ")
[Third-Party Shop Floor Execution - Process Industry (3W3)](https://rapid.sap.com/bp/#/scopeitems/3W3 " Link To BP ")
[Third-Party Shop Floor Execution - Discrete Industry (3W4)](https://rapid.sap.com/bp/#/scopeitems/3W4 " Link To BP ")

parameters.description: New entity

parameters.name: ConfirmationGroup
parameters.description:
Confirmation Group  
(Value needs to be enclosed in single quotes)

parameters.name: ConfirmationCount
parameters.description:
Order Confirmation  
(Value needs to be enclosed in single quotes)

parameters.name: PostingDate
parameters.description:
Posting Date  
(Value needs to be enclosed in single quotes and prefixed with `datetime`, e.g. `datetime'2017-12-31T00:00'`)

parameters.name: ConfirmationText
parameters.description:
Confirmation Text  
(Value needs to be enclosed in single quotes)

parameters.name: ExternalSystemConfirmation
parameters.description:
External Key  
(Value needs to be enclosed in single quotes and prefixed with `guid`, e.g. `guid'01234567-0123-0123-0123-0123456789ab'`)

schema.example:
--request-separator
Content-Type: application/http
Content-Transfer-Encoding: binary

GET ProdnOrdConfMatlDocItm HTTP/1.1
Accept: application/json


--request-separator--

--response-separator
Content-Type: application/http

HTTP/1.1 200 OK
Content-Type: application/json

{...}
--response-separator--

MaterialDocument.title: Material Document
MaterialDocument.description:
Number of Material Document  
Alphanumeric key uniquely identifying the document.  
Number of the material document with which a goods movement was posted.Together with the material document year, the document number constitutes the key via which a material document is accessed.

MaterialDocumentItem.title: Material Doc.Item
MaterialDocumentItem.description:
Item in Material Document  
Specifies the number that uniquely identifies an item in .

MaterialDocumentYear.title: Material Doc. Year
MaterialDocumentYear.description:
Material Document Year  
Calendar year in which the material document was posted.  
In conjunction with the document number, the material document year constitutes the key via which a material document is accessed.

Material.title: Material
Material.description:
Material Number for Order  
Number of the material that is to be produced with this order.

Reservation.title: Reservation
Reservation.description:
Number of reservation/dependent requirements  
Alphanumeric key uniquely identifying the document.

ReservationItem.title: Reservation Item
ReservationItem.description: Item Number of Reservation / Dependent Requirements

Batch.title: Batch
Batch.description:
Batch Number  
Assigns a material that is manufactured in batches or production lots to a specific batch.

SalesOrder.title: Sales Order
SalesOrder.description: Number of the sales order to which the order is to be settled.

SalesOrderItem.title: Sales Order Item
SalesOrderItem.description: Item in the sales order to which the order is to be settled.

WBSElementExternalID.title: WBS Element
WBSElementExternalID.description:
Work Breakdown Structure Element (WBS Element) Edited  
External 24-character name of an operative WBS element without a conversion routine stored in the domain.

Supplier.title: Supplier
Supplier.description:
Supplier's Account Number  
Alphanumeric key uniquely identifying the document.  
With the supplier number, information from the supplier master record (such as the supplier's address and bank details) is copied into a purchasing document (such as a request for quotation or a purchase order).You can use the supplier number to keep track of requests for quotation, purchase orders and outline agreements.

Customer.title: Customer
Customer.description:
Account number of customer  
Uniquely identifies a customer.  
This customer number is used for managing customer special stocks.

IsCompletelyDelivered.title: Delivery Completed
IsCompletelyDelivered.description:
"Delivery Completed" Indicator  
Indicates that the item is to be regarded as closed.

ShelfLifeExpirationDate.title: SLED/BBD
ShelfLifeExpirationDate.description:
Shelf Life Expiration or Best-Before Date  
The date is set upon goods receipt in one of the following ways:  
You enter it yourself.You enter a date of production, and the system calculates the shelf life expiration date from the date of production plus the shelf life in days (from the material master record).NoteThis date can still be changed upon receipt of the usage decision for an inspection lot.

StorageType.title: Storage Type
StorageType.description:
The storage type is a subdivision of a complex, physical warehouse. Different storage types are identified by their warehousing technique, form of organization, or their function.  
A typical warehouse could have the following storage types:Goods receipt areaPicking areaHigh-rack storage areaBulk storage areaOpen storage areaGoods issue area

StorageBin.title: Storage Bin
StorageBin.description:
The storage bin (sometimes referred to as a "slot") is the smallest addressable unit in a warehouse. It identifies the exact location in the warehouse where goods can be stored.  
A storage bin can be further sub-divided into bin sections. Several different materials (quants) can be stored in one bin at the same time.

MaterialDocumentItemText.title: Text
MaterialDocumentItemText.description:
Item Text  
Contains an explanatory text on the line item.  
Line item texts can be used internally and externally. To be able to distinguish between these, you must begin texts for external use with "*". These texts can then be printed on all correspondence, dunning notices, payment advice notes, etc. The asterisk is removed when the text is printed.This function is only available in the FI component. It cannot be used in Materials Management.

EntryUnit.title: Unit of Entry
EntryUnit.description:
Unit of entry  
Specifies the unit of measure in which the goods movement or inventory count is entered.  
Enter a unit of measure here only if it differs from the default unit of measure.There are the following default units of measure:the order unit for goods receipts with reference to purchase ordersthe production unit for goods receipts with reference to production ordersthe unit of issue for other goods movementsIf the default unit of measure has not been defined in the material master record, the system will suggest the stockkeeping unit.

OrderOperationInternalID.title: Operation Internal ID
OrderOperationInternalID.description: Internal Identifier of an Operation or Activity

Language.title: Language Key
Language.description:
The language key indicates  
- the language in which texts are displayed,- the language in which you enter texts,- the language in which the system prints texts.

Material.title: Material
Material.description:
Material Number for Order  
Number of the material that is to be produced with this order.

IsFinalConfirmation.title: Final Confirmation
IsFinalConfirmation.description:
Activation of Final Confirmation  
Specifies that no further confirmations are required.  
The system assigns the 'finally confirmed' system status.

OpenReservationsIsCleared.title: Clear Open Reservs.
OpenReservationsIsCleared.description:
Clear Open Reservations  
Indicator specifying that with a final confirmation, the indicator "delivery completed" is set for all open reservations that are assigned to the confirmed operation.  
The indicator is only set for the open reservations of the components that are not to be backflushed and for batch summary records for the components to be backflushed.The operation is given the system status "finally delivered" as well as the system status "finally confirmed".

APIConfHasNoGoodsMovements.title: No Goods Movement
APIConfHasNoGoodsMovements.description: Confirmation: No Goods Movement via API

LastChangeDate.title: Last Change
LastChangeDate.description:
Date of Last Change  
Date on which this rate was last changed.

LastChangedByUser.title: Changed By
LastChangedByUser.description: Name of Person who Changed Object

ConfirmationExternalEntryDate.title: Created on
ConfirmationExternalEntryDate.description:
External date of entry for confirmation  
Creation date of the record.

ConfirmationExternalEntryTime.title: Time
ConfirmationExternalEntryTime.description:
External time of entry for confirmation  
Time at which the document was posted and saved in the system.

EnteredByExternalUser.title: Created by
EnteredByExternalUser.description:
External creator of confirmation  
Name of the person, who originally enetered the confirmation, if it was created in a non-SAP system or using SAP fast entry for confirmations.

ExternalSystemConfirmation.title: External Key
ExternalSystemConfirmation.description: External Key for Confirmation (for example, from PDC System)

BreakDurationUnitISOCode.title: ISO code
BreakDurationUnitISOCode.description:
ISO code for unit of measurement  
ISO code for measurement units. An ISO code can be assigned to several internal measurement units of a dimension.  
The ISO code is important for EDI. It is used to convert the internal SAP measurement units into standard measurement units. Data exchange via EDI requires internal measurement units to be converted into standard measurement units.A list of the current internationally agreed ISO codes can be ordered from the UN commission responsible (WP.4 Trade Facilitation Recommendations, Recommendation 20):UN Economic Commission for EuropeInformation OfficePalais des Nations1211 GenevaSwitzerlande-mail: info.ece@unece.orgor viewed directly on the Internet:http://www.unece.org/cefact/codesfortrade/codes_index.htmFor more information, see SAP Note 69063.

ConfirmedBreakDuration.title: Confirmed Break Time
ConfirmedBreakDuration.description: Specified the confirmed break time for the operation.

ConfirmedExecutionStartDate.title: Start of Execution
ConfirmedExecutionStartDate.description:
Confirmed Start Date of Execution  
Date on which the execution/setup of the operation started.

ConfirmedExecutionEndDate.title: Finish Execution
ConfirmedExecutionEndDate.description:
Confirmed Finish Date of Execution  
Date on which the execution / teardown of the operation finished.

ConfirmationUnit.title: Confirmation Unit
ConfirmationUnit.description:
Confirmation Unit of Measure  
Unit in which the yield/scrap is confirmed.

ConfirmationUnitISOCode.title: ISO code
ConfirmationUnitISOCode.description:
ISO code for unit of measurement  
ISO code for measurement units. An ISO code can be assigned to several internal measurement units of a dimension.  
The ISO code is important for EDI. It is used to convert the internal SAP measurement units into standard measurement units. Data exchange via EDI requires internal measurement units to be converted into standard measurement units.A list of the current internationally agreed ISO codes can be ordered from the UN commission responsible (WP.4 Trade Facilitation Recommendations, Recommendation 20):UN Economic Commission for EuropeInformation OfficePalais des Nations1211 GenevaSwitzerlande-mail: info.ece@unece.orgor viewed directly on the Internet:http://www.unece.org/cefact/codesfortrade/codes_index.htmFor more information, see SAP Note 69063.

ConfirmationYieldQuantity.title: Yield Quantity
ConfirmationYieldQuantity.description:
Yield to be Confirmed  
Yield that you want to confirm for the operation.

ConfirmationScrapQuantity.title: Scrap Quantity
ConfirmationScrapQuantity.description:
Scrap to Be Confirmed  
Scrap that you want to confirm for this operation.

ConfirmationReworkQuantity.title: Rework Quantity
ConfirmationReworkQuantity.description:
Current Confirmation Rework Quantity  
Indicates which rework quantity is currently to be confirmed.  
The rework quantity has the following effect:When you insert a reference operation set into the current order from the confirmation (using trigger points) the confirmed rework quantity is transferred as the operation quantity to the inserted rework operations.When you create a new order from the confirmation (using trigger points) the confirmed rework quantity is used as the order quantity for the rework order.A trigger point is not triggered when you enter a rework quantity; it is triggered when you set or reset a system status or when you set a user status.

OpWorkQuantityUnit1.title: Activity Unit of Measure
OpWorkQuantityUnit1.description: Unit of Measure for the Activity in Confirmation

OpConfirmedWorkQuantity1.title: Act. t/b Confirmed
OpConfirmedWorkQuantity1.description:
Activity Currently to be Confirmed  
Activity that you want to confirm for this operation.

NoFurtherOpWorkQuantity1IsExpd.title: No Remaining Act.
NoFurtherOpWorkQuantity1IsExpd.description:
Indicator: No Remaining Activity Expected  
Specifies that you do not expect any more confirmations for this activity.

OpenReservationsIsCleared.title: Clear Open Reservs.
OpenReservationsIsCleared.description:
Clear Open Reservations  
Indicator specifying that with a final confirmation, the indicator "delivery completed" is set for all open reservations that are assigned to the confirmed operation.  
The indicator is only set for the open reservations of the components that are not to be backflushed and for batch summary records for the components to be backflushed.The operation is given the system status "finally delivered" as well as the system status "finally confirmed".

ConfirmationScrapQuantity.description:

Scrap that you want to confirm for this operation.

ConfirmationReworkQuantity.title: Rework Quantity
ConfirmationReworkQuantity.description:
Current Confirmation Rework Quantity  
Indicates which rework quantity is currently to be confirmed.  
The rework quantity has the following effect:When you insert a reference operation set into the current order from the confirmation (using trigger points) the confirmed rework quantity is transferred as the operation quantity to the inserted rework operations.When you create a new order from the confirmation (using trigger points) the confirmed rework quantity is used as the order quantity for the rework order.A trigger point is not triggered when you enter a rework quantity; it is triggered when you set or reset a system status or when you set a user status.

Data exchange via EDI requires internal measurement units to be converted into standard measurement units.A list of the current internationally agreed ISO codes can be ordered from the UN commission responsible (WP.4 Trade Facilitation Recommendations, Recommendation 20):UN Economic Commission for EuropeInformation OfficePalais des Nations1211 GenevaSwitzerlande-mail: info.ece@unece.orgor viewed directly on the Internet:http://www.unece.org/cefact/codesfortrade/codes_index.htmFor more information, see SAP Note 69063.
